intro: Brassaiopsis confluens, commonly known as the confluens hakea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and dense foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or cream in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
